|vendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |device_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subvendor_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |subdevice_id = <!-- Leave blank for none --> |id_string = <!-- PnP ID string --> |windosid = <!-- Windows ID, Leave blank for none --> |fcc_id = O7J-GL242204-0T, O7J-GL242201 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada ID, Leave blank for none --> |boardid = 2624035-01R4-2 |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id --> |oui = 00:03:2F
|chip1 = Texas Instruments;ACX100; |chip2 = RFMD;; |chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |chip4 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; -->
|antconn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |antenna = <!-- Antenna type --> |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = <!-- Receive sensitivity --> |transmit_power = <!-- Transmit power -->

|powledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |connactled = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |spdledcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |leddupcolor = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimmin = <!-- Size of device --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device -->
}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "GL2422T4 T1-1" and "2624035-01R4-2" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The device may not actually be using a standard PCMCIA interface, but it is using :the same connector, form factor, and lacks the CardBus strip. This is an access point / router wireless module. :00:03:2F OUI on the FCC sample label.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
